flowRoot.flowPara: Assume you have a texture wiith a beautiful arc...
The library must know exactly where the arc actually is and how it is oriented - it can not analyse the picture, so you have! to tell it what to do!
An arc can be defined by it's ORIGIN, the RADIUS (r) and two angles, the opening ANGLE and ROTATION. Since this shall produce something actually visible, we also need a THICKNESS (t)

The example to the left shows how I created the first textures for yahud. This orientation saves a bit of space (in therms of Bytes) for large radius and arc angles at about 90 degrees or less. But most importantly, it allowed me to just copy the texture out of a mockup.
Note that here origin_x is negative since it actually is outside of the texture (and left of the pole of its coordinate system)
